sen.j: 糸印（いといん）とは、明代の中国で造られ、戦国時代 (日本)から桃山時代までに日本にもたらされた、鋳銅製の印章のことである。
sen.e: Itoin is a copper seal made in China in Ming Dynasty and brought into Japan over the Sengoku period (period of warring states) and the Momoyama period.
Itoin is a copper seal made in China in Ming Dynasty and brought into Japan over the Sengoku period (period of warring states) and the Momoyama period.
Itoin is a copper seal made in China in Ming Dynasty and brought into Japan over the Sengoku period (period of warring states) and the Momoyama period.

sen.j: 高さは平均3 – 4センチ、重さは50グラム程度。
sen.e: The height is 3-4 centimeters on average, and the weight is around 50g.
The height is 3-4 centimeters on average, and the weight is around 50g.
The height is 3-4 centimeters on average, and the weight is around 50g.

sen.j: 多くが良質の青銅製で深みのある地色を出す。
sen.e: Most are made of high quality bronze, and a deep color of the ground appears.
Most are made of high quality bronze, and a deep color of the ground appears.
Most are made of high quality bronze, and a deep color of the ground appears.

sen.j: 稀に黄銅や赤銅がある。
sen.e: The color of brass or brown is rare.
The color of brass or brown is rare.
The color of brass or brown is rare.

sen.j: 割型製法なので中空となり見た目より軽い。
sen.e: It is hollow due to a process of making with split molds, and thus has a lighter weight than it looks.
It is hollow due to a process of making with split molds, and thus has a lighter weight than it looks.
It is hollow due to a process of making with split molds, and thus has a lighter weight than it looks.

sen.j: 印面は薄い板状になっている。
sen.e: The face of a seal has a form of thin plate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The face of a seal has a form of thin plate.
The face of a seal has a form of thin plate.

sen.j: 鈕の部分は動物鈕・人物鈕を中心に多種多様で200種類以上確認されている。
sen.e: There are various kinds of chu (finger grip of a seal), such as animal-shape chu or man-shape chu, mainly, and more than 200 kinds has been recognized.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There are various kinds of chu (finger grip of a seal), such as animal-shape chu or man-shape chu, mainly, and more than 200 kinds has been recognized.
There are various kinds of chu (finger grip of a seal), such as animal-shape chu or man-shape chu, mainly, and more than 200 kinds has been recognized.

sen.j: 例外なく綬を通す為の孔が穿たれている。
sen.e: A bore to pass a ribbon through is provided without exception.
A bore to pass a ribbon through is provided without exception.
A bore to pass a ribbon through is provided without exception.

sen.j: 印面は正方形・円形が多いが、それ以外にも多様な形状がある。
sen.e: Most of the seal have a square or circular face, but may have a face in other various shapes.
Most of the seal have a square or circular stamping surface, but may have one in other various shapes.
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。 face → stamping surfacea face → one
sen.e: Most of the seal have a square or circular stamping surface, but may have one in other various shapes.

sen.j: その印文はほとんどが陽刻である。
sen.e: Most of inmon (words or symbols engraved on the seal) are yokoku (raised characters.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Most of inmon (words or symbols engraved on the seal) are yokoku (raised characters.)
Most of inmon (words or symbols engraved on the seal) are yokoku (raised characters.)

sen.j: 一見漢字のようであるがその9割は判読できない。
sen.e: They seem to be kanji (Chinese characters), but 90 percent of them cannot be interpreted.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: They seem to be kanji (Chinese characters), but 90 percent of them cannot be interpreted.
They seem to be kanji (Chinese characters), but 90 percent of them cannot be interpreted.

sen.j: 辛うじて読める文字には「封」・「封信」・「平安家書」などのような書信に関係するものから遊印などが見られる。
sen.e: Barely readable characters includes those relate to letters such as "封", "封信", and "平安家書", and Yuin (seal carved favorite words or phrases.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処、漢字が焦点となっているため、英訳しませんでした。
sen.e: Barely readable characters includes those relate to letters such as '封,' '封信,' and '平安家書,' and Yuin (seal carved favorite words or phrases.)
Barely readable characters includes those relate to letters such as '封,' '封信,' and '平安家書,' and Yuin (seal carved favorite words or phrases.)

sen.j: 捺印したときのことを考慮しない左右反転していない文言もある。
sen.e: There also include some terms that do not reverse in right and left without considering of sealing.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Some of the terms were not even horizontally reversed, with the lack of consideration of sealing procedure.
sen.cmt: do not reverse in right and leftでは分りにくいと考えて再構成しました。
sen.e: Some of the words engraved on the seal were not even horizontally reversed, indicating that how it turns out when it is sealed had not been considered.

sen.j: 肖生印（図案）も僅かだが見られる。
sen.e: There includes a little shosei-in (seal on which twelve Chinese zodiac signs are carved) (design.)
Small number of shosei-in (seal on which twelve Chinese zodiac signs are carved) (design) are found.
sen.cmt: there includesはあまりよい表現ではないように思います。再構成しました。
sen.e: Small number of shosei-in (seal on which twelve Chinese zodiac signs are carved) (design) are found.

sen.j: これらの印文や鈕は同じものが多く、それらの多様な組合せがある。
sen.e: These inmon and chu are almost of same types, and are combined in various ways.
These inmon and chu are limited in variation, but are combined in various ways.
sen.cmt: almost of same types, and → limited in variation, but
sen.e: These inmon and chu are limited in variation, but are combined in various ways.

sen.j: 他と全く重複していない糸印は少ない。
sen.e: There are few itoin that do not overlap with others at all.
There are few itoin that do not overlap with others at all.
There are few itoin that do not overlap with others at all.

tit.cmt: theoryだけでは仮説の意味にならないように思います。

sen.j: 糸印の本来の用途は、日明貿易における生糸輸入時の信証に利用したとする説が有力である。
sen.e: A reliable theory is that itoin was originally used for an evidence of raw silk import in Japan-Ming trade.
A reliable theory is that itoin was originally used as seal of approval when trading raw silk in Japan-Ming trade.
sen.cmt: used for an evidence of → used as seal of approval when trading
sen.e: A reliable theory is that itoin was originally used as seal of approval when trading raw silk in Japan-Ming trade.

sen.j: この説では、生糸を束ねる毎にひとつの糸印で封印し、また日本側での受領印としたとしている。
sen.e: In this theory, raw silk was sealed with one itoin each time of bundling up, and the itoin was regarded as a receipt stamp in the Japanese side.
In this theory, raw silk was sealed with one itoin each time of bundling up, and the itoin was regarded as a receipt stamp in the Japanese side.
In this theory, raw silk was sealed with one itoin each time of bundling up, and the itoin was regarded as a receipt stamp in the Japanese side.

sen.j: その時期については室町時代の勘合貿易とする説、その後の慶長年間とする説がある。
sen.e: In one theory, it is assumed that the time is the tally trade (between Japan and the Ming dynasty) in the Muromachi period, and in another theory, the later Keicho era.
In one theory, it is assumed that the time is the tally trade (between Japan and the Ming dynasty) in the Muromachi period, and in another theory, the later Keicho era.
In one theory, it is assumed that the time is the tally trade (between Japan and the Ming dynasty) in the Muromachi period, and in another theory, the later Keicho era.

sen.j: その他に文鎮説、根付説、高麗印の模倣説、仕入判（量産品）説などがある。
sen.e: Other theories include that of a paperweight, that of netsuke, that of imitation of a Goreo seal, and that of a purchase stamp (products in bulk.)

Other theories include that of a paperweight, that of netsuke (miniature carving attached to the end of a cord hanging from a pouch), that of imitation of a Goreo seal (Korean seal), and that of a purchase stamp (products in bulk.)
sen.cmt: 用語集よりカッコ内を補足しました。
sen.e: Other theories include that of a paperweight, that of netsuke (miniature carving attached to the end of a cord hanging from a pouch), that of imitation of a Goreo seal (Korean seal), and that of a purchase stamp (products in bulk.)

sen.j: なお、日本産とする説もあったが、上海博物館に収蔵が確認されたことから中国で鋳造されたことが明らかとなった。
sen.e: The theories also included that of production in Japan, but casting in China has been determined since it was affirmed that it was stored in the Shanghai Museum.
The theories also included that of production in Japan, but casting in China has been determined since it was affirmed that it was stored in the Shanghai Museum.
The theories also included that of production in Japan, but casting in China has been determined since it was affirmed that it was stored in the Shanghai Museum.

sen.j: 江戸時代には「古銅印」・「古鋳印」と呼ばれ、俗称では「干支印」・「紐印」・「博多印」とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: In the Edo period, it was called "kodoin", or "kochu-in", and also called as common names "eto-in", "ju-in", or "Hakata-in."
In the Edo period, it was called 'kodoin,' or 'kochu-in,' and also called as common names 'eto-in,' 'ju-in,' or 'Hakata-in.'
In the Edo period, it was called 'kodoin,' or 'kochu-in,' and also called as common names 'eto-in,' 'ju-in,' or 'Hakata-in.'

sen.j: 最初に糸印と呼んだのは明治30年「考古学雑誌」に「糸印の考」として発表した横井時冬である。
sen.e: Tokifuyu YOKOI firstly called itoin who published it as "A study of Itoin" in "Kokogaku Zasshi" in 1897.
Tokifuyu YOKOI firstly called it itoin when he published 'A study of Itoin' in 'Kokogaku Zasshi' (Archeology Magazine) in 1897.
sen.cmt: call itoin → call it itoinwho published it as → when he published
sen.e: It was Tokifuyu YOKOI who first called it 'itoin' when he released 'A study of Itoin' in 'Kokogaku Zasshi' (Archeology Magazine) published in 1897.

sen.j: 戦国時代の武将が好んで糸印を利用しているが、とりわけ豊臣秀吉の蚯蚓印の印判状はよく知られている。
sen.e: Busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period preferably used itoin, and especially well known is Inbanjo with mimizu-in (seal of a worm) of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

Busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states) preferably used itoin, and especially well known is Inbanjo (license with a seal) with mimizu-in (seal of a worm) of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
sen.cmt: 用語集よりカッコ内を補足しました。
sen.e: Busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states) preferably used itoin, and especially well known is Inbanjo (license with a seal) with mimizu-in (seal of a worm) of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 江戸時代初期には近衛信尹や小堀遠州などの風流人が、画家では狩野探幽、土佐光起や円山応挙、谷文晁、高久靄厓、椿椿山などが好んで自らの落款印としている。
sen.e: In the early Edo period, men of refined taste such as Nobutada KONOE or Enshu KOBORI, painters such as Tanyu Kano, Mitsuoki TOSA, Oukyo MARUYAMA, Buncho TANI, Aigai TAKAKU, and Chinzan TSUBAKI preferably used itoin as their own Rakkan-in.

In the early Edo period, men of refined taste such as Nobutada KONOE and Enshu KOBORI, painters such as Tanyu Kano, Mitsuoki TOSA, Oukyo MARUYAMA, Buncho TANI, Aigai TAKAKU, and Chinzan TSUBAKI preferably used itoin as their own Rakkan-in (seal to be put on a piece of calligraphy by a calligrapher when the piece is completed).
sen.cmt: 用語集よりカッコ内を補足しました。
sen.e: In the early Edo period, men of refined taste such as Nobutada KONOE and Enshu KOBORI, painters such as Tanyu Kano, Mitsuoki TOSA, Oukyo MARUYAMA, Buncho TANI, Aigai TAKAKU, and Chinzan TSUBAKI preferably used itoin as their own Rakkan-in (seal to be put on a piece of calligraphy by a calligrapher when the piece is completed).

sen.j: 印聖と呼ばれる高芙蓉は糸印を愛し、編纂した印譜に印影を載せている。
sen.e: Fuyo KO referred to as insei loved itoin, and putted impressions of seal on the inpu (compilation of seal marks) he edited.
Fuyo KO, known as insei (master of sealing), loved itoin, and included impressions of seal on the inpu (compilation of seal marks) he compiled.
sen.cmt: referred to as insei → known as insei (master of sealing), putted → included
sen.e: Fuyo KO, known as insei (master of sealing), loved itoin, and included impressions of seal on the inpu (compilation of seal marks) he compiled.

sen.j: また芙蓉の校定した『古銅印彙』などは収録のすべてが糸印の印影である。
sen.e: Collections in "Kodo Ini" that Fuyo specified the original condition by comparing with other writings are entirely impressions of seal of itoin.
Collections in "Kodo Ini" that Fuyo specified the original condition by comparing with other writings are entirely impressions of seal of itoin.
Collections in "Kodo Ini" that Fuyo specified the original condition by comparing with other writings are entirely impressions of seal of itoin.

sen.j: 糸印は根付の起源として有力で、舶載された糸印を帯に提げるうちに日本独自の根付が発達したとものとする。
sen.e: Itoin is reliable as the origin of netsuke, and it is assumed that Japanese original netsuke has been developed with the shipped itoin hung on an obi.
Itoin is reliable as the origin of netsuke, and it is assumed that Japanese original netsuke has been developed with the shipped itoin hung on an obi.
Itoin is reliable as the origin of netsuke, and it is assumed that Japanese original netsuke has been developed with the shipped itoin hung on an obi.

sen.j: 初期のころの根付には糸印そっくりのものがある。
sen.e: Some netsuke in the early days is quite similar to itoin.
Some netsuke in the early days is quite similar to itoin.
Some netsuke in the early days is quite similar to itoin.

sen.j: 糸印は、現在も好事家の間で収集・愛玩の対象となっている。
sen.e: Nowadays, itoin has been a target as collection and fancy among dilettantes.
Nowadays, itoin has been a target as collection and fancy among dilettantes.
Nowadays, itoin has been a target as collection and fancy among dilettantes.
